page.title: 04FULBOURN WINDMILL
page.content: Fulbourn windmill stands on an outlying spur of the Gog Magog hills,overlooking the village and the Fens. It was built in 1808 for John Chaplin by the firm of Thomas Hunt of Soham.An octagonal smock mill, it is 15 metres high and made of oak with a brick base.It has three pairs of millstones. It was struck by lightning in 1933;its fantail was blown off in 1936. Power was provided by a tractor for a year, but the mill finally closed in 1937. The Fulbourn Windmill Society, a voluntary body have been restoring the moving parts and maintaining the building since 1974.The mill will not work again because the cap is tilted and would cost a prohibitive amount to rectify.
